page.title: 19TOURISM
page.content:
The peace and unspoilt nature of the countryside attract{visitors}at all times of year, especially from the nearby town of{Callington.
{Walking}is the most popular activity and there are{25kms of public {footpath}in the area, mostly in the woods alongside the{river Lynher}and around{Cadsonbury Hill.}Some footpaths though, such as the one from Newbridge to Colquite are almost impossible to find! { Fishing}is also common. {Brown {trout}are found in the river all year round, while{sea trout, salmon}and {eels}can be caught in season. However, anglers claim that the pig farm upstream has polluted the river and spoilt the fishing in recent years.
